How to Install eddebian-menueditor on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • eddebian-menueditor

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install eddebian-menueditor on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing eddebian-menueditor on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall eddebian-menueditor in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install eddebian-menueditor, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install eddebian-menueditor Using apt

To install eddebian-menueditor in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install eddebian-menueditor using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install eddebian-menueditor

The installation of eddebian-menueditor might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install eddebian-menueditor Using apt-get

To install eddebian-menueditor using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install eddebian-menueditor.

sudo apt-get -y install eddebian-menueditor

Install eddebian-menueditor Using Synaptic

To install eddebian-menueditor using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install eddebian-menueditor on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for eddebian-menueditor. This will display the eddebian-menueditor package in the package window, now to install eddebian-menueditor, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the eddebian-menueditor package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of eddebian-menueditor.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install eddebian-menueditor Using aptitude

To install eddebian-menueditor on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of eddebian-menueditor.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install eddebian-menueditor using the command aptitude install eddebian-menueditor.

sudo aptitude -y install eddebian-menueditor

How to Upgrade eddebian-menueditor on debian

If you want to upgrade the eddebian-menueditor package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade eddebian-menueditor using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade eddebian-menueditor to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade eddebian-menueditor.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade eddebian-menueditor sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade eddebian-menueditor

Upgrade eddebian-menueditor using Aptitude

To upgrade eddebian-menueditor using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade eddebian-menueditor.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade eddebian-menueditor

Upgrade eddebian-menueditor using Synaptic

To upgrade eddebian-menueditor using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for eddebian-menueditor, now right-click eddebian-menueditor, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade eddebian-menueditor just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall eddebian-menueditor on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall eddebian-menueditor from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just eddebian-menueditor, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove eddebian-menueditor

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of eddebian-menueditor

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of eddebian-menueditor you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge eddebian-menueditor

Remove eddebian-menueditor using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall eddebian-menueditor using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for eddebian-menueditor, right-click the eddebian-menueditor package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall eddebian-menueditor click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install eddebian-menueditor on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade eddebian-menueditor using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of eddebian-menueditor then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
